summary: OpenTelemetry integration is using incorrect timestamp conversion to nanoseconds, causing failures with OTLP. The fix requires using Time objects directly from Temporalio::Workflow.now instead of converting to nanos.
userImpact: OpenTelemetry integration fails when exporting traces via OTLP due to incorrect timestamp handling.
rootCause: Timestamp values are being converted to nanoseconds when they should remain as Time objects from Temporalio::Workflow.now
proposedFix: Change lines 458-464 in temporalio/lib/temporalio/contrib/open_telemetry.rb to use Time objects directly without nanos conversion
resolutionDetails: Issue was resolved by updating the OpenTelemetry timestamp handling to use Time objects directly instead of converting to nanoseconds
keyQuote: need to change to just use the `Time` from `Temporalio::Workflow.now` as the timestamp, do not convert to nanos
